metadata.title: CVE-2017-17558 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The usb_destroy_configuration function in drivers/usb/core/config.c in theUSB core subsystem in the Linux kernel through 4.14.5 does not consider themaximum number of configurations and interfaces before attempting torelease resources, which allows local users to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds write access) or possibly have unspecified other impact viaa crafted USB device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17558` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-lowlatency - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-119-generic - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-lowlatency - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-119-generic - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1016-aws - 4.4.0-1016.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-157.207').
